meanings.definition: Relating to actuarial science or calculations.
meanings.sent1: The actuarially sound report provided accurate financial projections.
meanings.sent2: The insurance company used actuarially determined rates to set premiums.
meanings.sent3: The actuarially gifted mathematician always knew the right numbers to pick in the lottery.
meanings.sent4: Her decision-making process was as precise and reliable as an actuarially calculated risk assessment.
meanings.sent5: The actuarially precise calculations saved the company from financial ruin.

meanings.definition: In an actuarial manner or using actuarial methods.
meanings.sent1: She actuarially analyzed the data to predict future trends.
meanings.sent2: The pension fund was managed actuarially to ensure long-term sustainability.
meanings.sent3: He comically tried to actuarially estimate the number of jellybeans in the jar.
meanings.sent4: The project was completed ahead of schedule, thanks to her actuarially efficient planning.
meanings.sent5: The team actuarially adjusted their strategy based on the changing market conditions.
